column4: HSBC must face Chicago predatory lending lawsuit - judge
column5: Sept 30 HSBC Holdings Plc must face a lawsuit accusing the British bank of violating the U.S. Fair Housing Act by engaging in predatory mortgage lending in the Chicago area  a federal judge in that city ruled on Wednesday.

column4: Nigeria to reissue 10-year bond after JP Morgan index expulsion
column5: LAGOS  Sept 30 Nigeria plans to re-issue its five- and 10-year bonds in the last quarter of the year to raise up to 270 billion naira after JP Morgan's index on Wednesday delisted half of the maturities belonging to Africa's biggest economy.

column4: DEALS-Third-quarter M&A near record despite market jitters
column5: NEW YORK/LONDON  Sept 29 Mergers and acquisitions globally exceeded $1 trillion in value in the third quarter of 2015  the third highest on record  as a stock market plunge and more expensive debt financing did not prevent big companies from going ahead with their dream deals.

column4: UPDATE 1-Pentagon warns against further consolidation among big arms makers
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 30 Pentagon officials warned on Wednesday against further consolidation in the U.S. weapons industry because fewer defense contractors could lead to higher costs  decreased innovation and less competition.

column4: Lockheed-Boeing launch venture wins $882 million U.S. contract
column5: WASHINGTON United Launch Alliance  a joint venture of Lockheed Martin Corp  and Boeing Co   has won an $882 million contract to continue launching satellites for the U.S. Air Force with its Delta IV and Atlas V rockets  the Pentagon said Tuesday.

column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 30 The Federal Reserve said on Wednesday it had approved M&T Bank Corp's acquisition of Hudson City Bancorp Inc  three years after the deal was first proposed.

column4: Japan's Mizuho takes 16 percent stake in Matthews Asia
column5: TOKYO  Sept 30 Mizuho Financial Group Inc  said on Wednesday it will buy a 16 percent stake in Asia-focused asset manager Matthews International Capital Management LLC.

column4: UPDATE 2-MSCI to keep Peru bourse in 'emerging market' group for now
column5: LIMA  Sept 30 Index provider MSCI Inc  opted on Wednesday to keep Peru's bourse in its "emerging market" group but warned it might downgrade the stock exchange to a higher-risk "frontier" status in nine months if liquidity sinks further.

column4: MSCI says to keep Peru bourse in 'emerging market' group for now
column5: LIMA  Sept 30 MSCI Inc said on Wednesday it decided not to reclassify Peru's bourse as a "frontier market" from its current "emerging market" status but will reevaluate a potential downgrade to the higher-risk group next year.

column4: GM and Navistar to develop and make commercial trucks

column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 30 Brazilian ethanol producers will benefit in the medium term from this week's decision by state-run oil company Petrobras to raise gasoline prices  which will boost demand for the biofuel and allow mills to increase margins  experts said on Wednesday.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 30 (IFR) - Bonds issued by troubled state-run Brazilian oil company Petrobras were enjoying a rare rally on Wednesday following news that it would raise local gasoline and diesel prices.

column5: SAO PAULO  Sept 30 Brazil's financial markets rose on Wednesday  with the Bovespa stock index boosted by a fuel price increase at state-run oil firm Petrobras and the currency up on a potential shake-up in President Dilma Rousseff's cabinet.     Other Latin American financial markets rose as well as investors took advantage of historic lows in asset prices. column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX ends up 2.1 percent; Valeant rebounds
column5: TORONTO  Sept 30 Canada's main stock index surged more than 2 percent on Wednesday as Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc rebounded and higher-than-expected domestic growth data gave a range of sectors a healthy boost amid end-of-quarter positioning.
